meanings.definition: To surpass in raving or extravagance.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outrave her friends with her wild stories.
meanings.sent2: The singer would outrave the audience with her incredible performance.
meanings.sent3: At the party, he decided to outrave everyone by dancing on the tables.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music outraves any other interest she has.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display would outrave any other show in town.

meanings.sent1: He tends to outrave about his favorite movies to anyone who will listen.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer would outrave about her latest collection for hours.
meanings.sent3: The cat would outrave at the sight of a mouse in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement would outrave any other emotion she was feeling.
meanings.sent5: The storm would outrave any previous ones in its intensity.
